revised_title: Particle Confinement and Adiabatic Invariance in Mirror Magnetic Traps
tldr: The article discusses the problem of particle motion and confinement in mirror magnetic traps, focusing on the concept of adiabatic invariance and the role of resonant perturbations in causing dynamical chaos. The author introduces a new adiabaticity parameter to describe the resonant, cumulative variation in particle motion, which helps in understanding the conditions for particle confinement and the mechanisms of particle diffusion out of the trap.
